metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28284 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: SVG's <use> element could have been used to load unexpected content that could have executed script in certain circumstances. While the specification seems to allow this, other browsers do not, and web developers relied on this property for script security so gecko's implementation was aligned with theirs. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 99. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28284` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2 firefox-geckodriver - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2 firefox-mozsymbols - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
